basics.name: Glenn Galvizo
basics.label: Research Assistant
basics.summary: Hello all! I hold a B.S. in Computer Science and a certificate in Mathematical Biology from the University of Hawaii at Manoa. My next endeavor entails pursuing a Ph.D. in Computer Science at the University of California, Irvine this coming Fall.

education.institution: Leeward Community College, Pearl City, HI
courses: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science I-II

awards.title: Very Large Data Base Scholarship
awards.awarder: Very Large Data Base Endowment Incorperated
awards.summary: $2000 merit based scholarship to study data management related topics.

awards.title: Undergraduate Research Opportunity Program Grant
awards.summary: $4890 to fund the project 'Analysis and Optimization of Lost-in-Space Star Identification'.

awards.title: Hawaii Space Flight Laboratory Traineeship
awards.summary: $3000 to help develop sensor logging and flight path estimation software for CATSAT-1, a stationary payload on a sounding rocket.

papers.text: Galvizo G. Efficient Parameter Estimation for Human Microsatellite Mutation. Accepted writing for the Mathematical Biology Certificate Committee at the University of Hawaii at Manoa, Nov. 30, 2018.

Galvizo G. Efficient Parameter Estimation for Human Microsatellite Mutation. Presented at the University of Hawaii at Manoa Undergraduate Showcase, Honolulu, HI, United States, Dec. 7, 2018; oral presentation.
Galvizo G. and Lim L. An Experimental Survey of Evaluation Strategies for Constellation Queries. Submitting for publication.

Galvizo G. Analysis and Optimization of Lost-in-Space Star Identification. Presented at the University of Hawaii at Manoa Undergraduate Showcase, Honolulu, HI, United States, Dec. 8, 2017; oral presentation.

Galvizo G., Izumigawa C., Lam J., Li T., Nguyen A., Saymo A., Xu P., Yasunaga C. Hawaii Space Flight Laboratory: Sounding Rocket Trainees. Presented at the Hawaii Space Grant Fellowship and Traineeship Symposium, Honolulu, HI, United States, Apr. 23, 2016; oral presentation.

Galvizo G., Izumigawa C., Li T., Nguyen A., Saymo A., Yasunaga C. Hawaii Space Flight Laboratory: Sounding Rocket Trainees. Presented at the Hawaii Space Grant Fellowship and Traineeship Symposium, Honolulu, HI, United States, Nov. 21, 2015; oral presentation.

work.summary: Mentor 4th-12th grade students in the development, design, and application of robotics through VEX.
highlights: Guide, mentor, and coach elementary to high school students in creating VEX and FRC competition robots.
Created and ran several lectures on the basics of RobotC programming for VEX.
Students are taught the basics of mechanical design, documentation, C-based programming, game strategy, project management, and teamwork.

work.summary: Research and analyze five existing blind star identification algorithms.
highlights: Implemented five different blind star identification methods.
Implemented a benchmark data generator in Python and C++.
Created and ran several experiments to test these identification methods.
Presented work at the 2017 fall UHM Undergraduate Showcase

work.company: University of Hawaii Information and Computer Sciences
work.summary: Manage lab machines for ICS department.
highlights: Serviced four labs of computers, users and the networks connecting them.
Assisted students and professors with all machine related issues
Automated the development and unattended installation and updates of Windows programs across all lab computers.
Developed Powershell scripts to automate Active Directory user account renewal and additions.

work.summary: Lead High level software student portions for NMSR and star tracker project.
highlights: Managed a Unix Gumstix device for a stationary payload on a sounding rocket.
Developed cross-platform memory/load/disk library for COSMOS project.
Developed COSMOS visualization tools with QT C++ Framework.
Created COSMOS agents and libraries for star based attitude estimation, and IMU based attitude estimation.

volunteer.summary: Ensure robotics game is played in fair and consistent manner.
Managed minutes and information regarding our meetings and community service events.
